title: Pressure - determine pressure on toy in pool

content.question: The swimming pool shown in the figure is filled to a depth of <math alttext="5.0 meters" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mn>5.0</mn><mspace width="0.2em"></mspace><mi mathvariant="normal">m</mi></math> with water of density <math alttext="1000 kilograms per cubic meter" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mn>1000</mn><mspace width="0.2em"></mspace><msup><mtext>kg/m</mtext><mn>3</mn></msup></math>. A toy submarine is lowered into the water until it is <math alttext="3.0 meters" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mn>3.0</mn><mspace width="0.2em"></mspace><mi mathvariant="normal">m</mi></math> from the bottom of the pool. What is the absolute pressure at the depth of the submarine?

choices.label: <math alttext="2.0 times 10 to the 4 power pascals" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mn>2.0</mn><mo>×</mo><msup><mn>10</mn><mn>4</mn></msup><mspace width="0.2em"></mspace><mtext>Pa</mtext></math>
<math alttext="3.0 times 10 to the 4 power pascals" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mn>3.0</mn><mo>×</mo><msup><mn>10</mn><mn>4</mn></msup><mspace width="0.2em"></mspace><mtext>Pa</mtext></math>
<math alttext="12 times 10 to the 4 power pascals" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mn>12</mn><mo>×</mo><msup><mn>10</mn><mn>4</mn></msup><mspace width="0.2em"></mspace><mtext>Pa</mtext></math>
<math alttext="13 times 10 to the 4 power pascals" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mn>13</mn><mo>×</mo><msup><mn>10</mn><mn>4</mn></msup><mspace width="0.2em"></mspace><mtext>Pa</mtext></math>

content.answer: <math alttext="12 times 10 to the 4 power pascals" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mn>12</mn><mo>×</mo><msup><mn>10</mn><mn>4</mn></msup><mspace width="0.2em"></mspace><mtext>Pa</mtext></math>

skill.text: 2.B: Calculate or estimate an unknown quantity with units from known quantities, by selecting and following a logical computational pathway.
